newsitem.title: USA: AFTER THE BELL - PLC up after Q2 results.
newsitem.headline: AFTER THE BELL - PLC up after Q2 results.

text.p: PLC Systems rose a bit in after hours trading Wednesday following the company's release of second quarter earnings that were better than analysts' expectations.
PLC shares were moving at 14-5/16, up from a close of 13-15/16, traders said.
PLC shares lost over half their value Tuesday after a U.S. Food and Drug Administration panel recommended rejecting the company's Heart Laser System.
"The stock got beat up so bad. When it gets beat up that bad, even just a little bit of good news helps," one dealer said.
PLC reported a second quarter loss of $0.16 a share. Wall Street had been expecting a $0.19 per share loss, according to First Call.
Also moving after the bell was JLG Industries, which was trading at 11-7/8, down from a close of 12-3/8.
The company issued warnings for its fourth quarter and fiscal 1998 results and announced a restructuring that included a 30 percent cut in its workforce.
Macromedia shares fell, trading at 10-1/2, down from an 11-1/2 close after reporting a first quarter loss of $0.03 per share, below the consensus estimate of a $0.02 loss.

Dealers said other stocks were trading in-line with their closing prices, following a day of sharp gains on Wall Street. The Dow, S&P 500 and Nasdaq all hit record highs, with the Dow jumping 80 to 8255 and the Nasdaq touching its first all-time high in two weeks.
The New York Stock Exchange said session one had volume of 2,100, compared with 3,200 Tuesday. Session two had volume of 2.9 million, compared with nearly 4.5 million.
